SEARCH
Package net.zypr.menuAPI.api

Interface Menu

All Known Subinterfaces:
ClosableMenu
All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractMenu, SimpleMenu
public interface Menu
Represents a menu interface that can be opened by a player and interacted with.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description

    getInventory()
    Gets the inventory associated with the menu.

    Gets the title of the menu.

    Handles a click event within the menu.

    Opens the menu for the specified player.

  • Method Details

    • open

      void open(org.bukkit.entity.Player player)
      Opens the menu for the specified player.
      Parameters:
      player - the player for whom the menu will be opened

    • setItem

      void setItem(int slot, org.bukkit.inventory.ItemStack item, MenuItemClickHandler handler)
      Sets an item in the specified slot with a click handler.
      Parameters:
      slot - the slot index where the item will be placed
      item - the ItemStack to set in the slot
      handler - the handler to execute when the item is clicked

    • setToggleItem

      void setToggleItem(int slot, boolean initialState, org.bukkit.inventory.ItemStack onItem, org.bukkit.inventory.ItemStack offItem, MenuToggleHandler handler)
      Sets a toggleable item in the specified slot.
      Parameters:
      slot - the slot index where the toggle item will be placed
      initialState - the initial state of the toggle (true for "on", false for "off")
      onItem - the ItemStack representing the "on" state
      offItem - the ItemStack representing the "off" state
      handler - the handler to execute when the toggle state changes

    • getTitle

      String getTitle()
      Gets the title of the menu.
      Returns:
      the title of the menu

    • getInventory

      org.bukkit.inventory.Inventory getInventory()
      Gets the inventory associated with the menu.
      Returns:
      the Inventory of the menu

    • handleClick

      void handleClick(MenuItemClickContext context)
      Handles a click event within the menu.
      Parameters:
      context - the context of the click event
